Module it.polimi.ingsw.triton.launcher
Package it.polimi.ingsw.triton.launcher.server.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.triton.launcher.server.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<ClientMessage>
public class Controller extends Object implements Observer<ClientMessage>
Controller is used to manage the game flow, using visitor pattern to modify the model and to send the correct following message, basing on ClientMessage type Controller is notified by virtual view, when a new message is received Login, number of players and game mode are not managed here, but in server Controller catches all exceptions that model throws

  • Method Details

    • createTowerColorRequestMessage

      public void createTowerColorRequestMessage(String username)
      Calls a method in virtualView to send the request to a player for selecting a tower color.
      Parameters:
      username - the receiver player's username of the message.

    • update

      public void update(ClientMessage message)
      This method is called by a virtual view notify.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<ClientMessage>
      Parameters:
      message - the message that was received from the client. Received message is used to modify the model, using overriding to establish what changes I have to do. modifyModel throws some exceptions, to manage the game flow correctly also in exceptional situations. 4 situations can be verified: Standard situation, the game is following the regular flow; Error situation, the user gave a wrong input, so the message must be re-sent; Exceptional situation, this game micro-phase is ended, so we need to start the next one. For example turn is changed; End game situations, the game is over and winner must be calculated.

    • addGameObserver

      public void addGameObserver(VirtualView virtualView)
      Adds an observer (virtual view) of the game.
      Parameters:
      virtualView - the virtual view that is an observer of the game.

      public void removeGameObserver(VirtualView virtualView)
      Removes an observer (virtual view) of the game.
      Parameters:

    • getVirtualViewByUsername

      public VirtualView getVirtualViewByUsername(String username) throws NoSuchElementException
      Parameters:
      username - the virtual view player's username.
      Returns:
      the virtual view associated to a specific player.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the virtual view doesn't exist.

    • disconnectAllPlayers

      public void disconnectAllPlayers()
      Disconnects all the players removing their virtual views and calling endGame() to reset the instance of the Game. Calling endGame(), Virtual Views will be removed as Game Observers.
